EVJ.A: The global maximum heat value is {0.99}.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Gas and Consumption or the cell corresponding to Electricity and Storage?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Electricity} and {Storage} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Coal and Efficiency or the cell corresponding to Distribution and Infrastructure?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Coal} and {Efficiency} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.38 to 0.50?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Distribution, Consumption), (Gas, Efficiency), (Renewables, Efficiency), (Waste Management, Infrastructure), (Distribution, Policy), (Water, Policy), (Water, Prices), (Renewables, Reliability), (Transmission, Reliability)}.
